trans-unit.source: Defines the interface to a control adapter.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
All control adapters must implement the IControlAdapter interface.
Usually, a control adapter inherits directly or indirectly from the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.ControlAdapter> base class, which provides a default implementation of this interface.
Returns a strongly typed reference to the associated control.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
A strongly typed reference to the associated control.
Called by base classes to create a templated UI.
Returns <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the instantiated templates must bind to available data (which usually happens on the first request).

Returns <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref> if the templates must not bind to data, and instead rely on view state to fill them in (which usually happens on subsequent postbacks).
Returns <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the event was handled.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
This method is called by a control when it receives a postback event notification, to check whether the event is adapter specific.

If the control implements <xref:System.Web.UI.IPostBackEventHandler> and receives a postback event, the <xref:System.Web.UI.IPostBackEventHandler.RaisePostBackEvent%2A> method of the control adapter is called.
If events sent to the control can vary depending on the target device, the control implementation of this method must call the HandlePostBackEvent method of the control adapter.
This method returns `true` or `false`, indicating whether the device adapter handled the event.
It returns `false` by default.
Name of the event.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the postback event was handled; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Accesses the approximate weight of a single item in the control.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
A value of `-1` indicates that the default weight for the element must be used.
The inheriting class must override this property.
For further information about overriding this property, see [Pagination](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/b4f4c4bc-226b-46ec-ae46-00497a32f4f2).
The approximate weight of a single item in the control.
Returns the adapter-specific view for a control.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
This method is called when the control loads its private view state.
A device adapter can save the adapter-specific view for a control.
The current view state.
Returns <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the adapter handles loading the post data.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
This method is called when a control that implements the <xref:System.Web.UI.IPostBackDataHandler> interface has its own <xref:System.Web.UI.IPostBackDataHandler.LoadPostData%2A> method invoked.
> [!NOTE] > Different devices might provide their data back to the calling server in different ways.
An example is the difference between how WML and HTML report back the results of a <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.SelectionList>.
Identifies the control.
Contains the collection of all incoming name values.
Provides a place to send private data to the control that might be required for loading of post data.
The control determines the type that is passed to the parameter.

Returns <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the required the object in `privateControlData` was changed, so the <xref:System.Web.UI.IPostBackDataHandler.RaisePostDataChangedEvent*> event can be raised.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the adapter handles loading the post data; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Called after an object, such as a form or a page, is initialized.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
You can override this method to set device-specific properties.
Inheriting classes can override this method to perform other tasks.
If this method is overridden in an inheriting class, you must call the base implementation.
An object (defined by <xref:System.EventArgs>) that contains event data.
Loads data that pertains to a control, a page, or a device adapter.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The OnLoad method is inherited from the control's parent.

If the control is a MobileControl control, then this method is inherited from the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control?displayProperty=fullName> class; if the control is a <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobilePage> control, then this method is inherited from the <xref:System.Web.UI.Page?displayProperty=fullName> class.
An object (defined by <xref:System.EventArgs>) that contains event data.
Called by the control's OnPreRender method, to perform adapter-specific work prior to rendering.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
An object (defined by <xref:System.EventArgs>) that contains event data.
Unloads data that pertains to a control, a page, or a device adapter.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
This method is called by the control's OnUnload method to perform adapter-specific unloading.
An object (defined by <xref:System.EventArgs>) that contains event data.
Returns the page associated with the device adapter.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Equivalent to calling the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileControl.MobilePage%2A>.
The page associated with the device adapter.
Called by the control's Render method to perform rendering.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
For the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.ControlAdapter> class, this method renders all the children of the control.
The text writer to receive output.
This method is called when the control saves its private view state.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
An adapter can save adapter-specific state for a control.
If no such functionality is required, the adapter returns `null` (`Nothing` in Visual Basic).
The newly saved adapter state.
Returns the approximate weight of the control, in characters.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
This property is used for form pagination.
A value of `-1` indicates that the default weight for the element must be used.
For further information, see [Pagination Support](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/78f2786d-0b5b-4760-9616-5027357713c2).
The approximate weight of the control, in characters.
